alert.note: Alert for Central Cook; DuPage; Eastern Will; Northern Cook; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 12 at 3:49AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT THROUGH 7 PM THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Illinois and northwest Indiana, including the following areas, in northeast Illinois, Central Cook, DuPage, Eastern Will, Northern Cook, Northern Will, Southern Cook and Southern Will. In northwest Indiana, Lake IN. * WHEN...Through 7 PM this evening. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Underpasses may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and thunderstorms are expected across the area today. Although individual storm movement is expected to be quick, there will be a couple rounds of storms containing heavy rainfall today. High atmospheric moisture content will support high rain rates up to 1 to 2 inches per hour. Soil moisture also remains elevated from recent heavy rainfall. Some flood storage reservoirs also remain nearly full. Central Cook County has the highest threat of flash flooding if heavier thunderstorms occur. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Watch for flash flooding means rapid-onset flooding is possible, but not yet certain, based upon the latest forecasts. Flash flooding is a dangerous situation. Persons with interests along area rivers, creeks, and other waterways should monitor the latest forecasts and be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Central Cook; DuPage; Eastern Will; Northern Cook; Northern Will; Southern Cook; Southern Will
